SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid syndrome is an autoimmune disease that presents with recurrent arteriovenous thrombosis, repeated pregnancy loss and elevated titres of antiphospholipid antibodies in the blood
It is a common cause of acquired thrombosis and can manifest within any part of the vascular tree
Inferior Venacava thrombosis at outset, however, is not a common manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus associated-antiphospholipid syndrome particularly in children
Here, we present a 14-year old girl who developed antiphospholipid syndrome as a presenting manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus
